Description: Black basalt block; cornice of uraei; recessed Hieroglyphic text including the cartouches and Horus-name of Psamtek I and two sunk relief representations of the king kneeling and offering bread to deities; more text on the reverse.
Curator's comments: O.Perdu (College de France) to include in Receuil d'inscriptions royales saites (forthcoming, 2002) Often erroneously referred to as "intercolumnar"
Bibliographic references: Yorke and Leake 1826 / Remarks on some Egyptian monuments in England (p. 10, pl. 10, fig. 28)
Porter and Moss 1934 / Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs, and Paintings: IV (p. 1)
Muller 1955 / Ein Konigsbildnis der 26. Dynastie mit der "Blauen Krone" im Museo Civico zu Bologna (p. 48, n. 4)
Bothmer 1960 / Egyptian Sculpture of the late period, 700 B.C. to A.D. 100 (p. 91)
Russman 1974 / The representation of the King in the XXVth dynasty (p. 32)
Bresciani 1975 / La collezione egizia nel Museo civico di Bologna (p. 72)
Morigi Govi and Sassatelli 1984 / Dalla stanza delle antichità al Museo civico : storia della formazione del Museo civico archeologico di Bologna (p. 152)
James 1988 / Ancient Egypt: the Land and its Legacy (fig. 3)
Mysliwiec 1988 / Royal portraiture of the Dynasties XXI-XXX (p. 46, p.51, p. 53, pp. 56- 57, p. 74, p. 119)
Shubert 1989 / Realistic Currents in Portrait Sculpture of the Saite and Persian periods in Egypt (p. 29)
Quirke 1990 / Who were the Pharaohs? A History of their Names with a List of Cartouches (p. 18)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Psamtek I
Acquisition name: Donated by: George III, King of the United Kingdom
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: John Stuart, 3rd Earl of Bute
Acquisition notes: From the collection of E.W. Montagu, via that of the Earl of Bute (Thompson, Letters on the British Museum (1767): 6).
